meanings.definition: Following a single line of descent.
meanings.sent1: The unilinear family tree traced back only through the father's side.
meanings.sent2: The unilinear path led straight to the top of the mountain.
meanings.sent3: The unilinear inheritance of the family fortune caused quite a stir at the reading of the will.
meanings.sent4: Her unilinear focus on her career left little room for personal relationships.
meanings.sent5: The unilinear pattern of growth in the plant made it easy to predict its future size.

meanings.definition: Progressing in a straight line or in a single direction.
meanings.sent1: The unilinear road stretched out endlessly before them.
meanings.sent2: The unilinear storyline of the movie kept the audience engaged.
meanings.sent3: The unilinear race track made for an exciting competition.
meanings.sent4: His unilinear train of thought made it difficult for others to follow his ideas.
meanings.sent5: The unilinear flow of traffic made the commute smooth and efficient.
